sentences: .. on vihma käest räästa alla sattunud
.. miks ta ometi nii loll oli ja võõrsile ei jääned – jooksis vihma käest räästa alla
translation: out of the frying pan into the fire
to get oneself into an even more difficult situation
context: The word 'vihma' is part of the Estonian idiom 'käest räästa alla', which means to go from a bad situation to an even worse one. It's typically used when someone escapes from one problem only to fall into another, equally or more problematic situation. This phrase is often applied metaphorically rather than literally talking about rain.
